message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.SOC, cs.CL 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) as it explores the evolution of polarization around controversial topics on Twitter. It could also belong to the sub-category of Social and Community Computing (cs.SD) as it studies the behavior of users in online communities. Additionally, it could be classified under Cybersecurity (cs.CY) as it deals with the security and privacy concerns of social media users. The paper also touches upon the field of Computational Social Science (cs.SOC) as it uses computational methods to analyze social phenomena. Finally, it could be categorized under Computation and Language (cs.CL) as it involves the analysis of natural language data on social media.
